messages.subject: Fwd: [AlwaysLearning] Chianca column on unschooling (No Sandra you don't suck:o)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/25/2006 11:33:09 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... ***LOL! OMG I would never write to someone I don t even know... YOU SUCK! ..... even if I
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/25/2006 11:33:09 AM Eastern Standard Time,
Sandra@... writes:


> Thanks, Nancy.
>
> I was into the fourth line of what you wrote below before I knew it
> wasn't building up to "But this time you've gone too far; you suck!"
>
> <g>
> I was relieved. <g>


***LOL! OMG I would never write to someone I don't even know..."YOU
SUCK!"..... even if I thought so. :o) but I might say something like..... Gee, you're a
reeeeal pain in the ........ no, just kidding I wouldn't even say that
either.

I always enjoy everything you write. I do get many chuckles and I appreciate
that in a person. I sometimes will forward things to my dh so he can be
enlightened also. <BG>
The "Fallacies" page is a funny one. We are sort of new to unschooling, heck,
we're new to hs'ing too. I can't believe how far we have come though. I am
soooo happy to see our dd's start to relax and enjoy all that life has to offer
them. It's amazing how much happier our life has become. Not that it was real
bad or anything, it's just better than ever! So much more peaceful! Our oldest
used have acne all the time and she was only 11. We pulled them out of ps a
little over a year ago, she's 12 now. A few months ago she said "Hey Mom! I
don't really have acne any more! I've been noticing it since I left school! Man I
LOVE this unschooling stuff!" Ahhhh..... no more forced learning, degrading
teachers, bullies, grades, begging to get a drink of water or simply go to the
bathroom etc.!

From, another fan of "The Holy Grail" <BG!> My dh and I rented that on our
first date 18 yrs ago:o) Our daughters are getting the accent down pretty good
these days, they take after their Dad sooo much. <g>

Nancy
